chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory A. Schneider is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory A. Schneider was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Gregory A. Schneider was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug counseling.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with felons, drug users/dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not to drive w/o valid license.

Per DOC Agt Mike McConville the deft has paid the court obligations in full except for 2 cents; therefore the PRH of 3/24/17 at 11:15am is cancelled; any money he pays toward supervision fees will be applied to the court obligations.

records.addlTxt: To amend JOC to 1 yr probation, each count.
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 3 the court imposes and stays a total sentence of 3 years WSP:  2 years initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision; on ct 2 the court imposes and stays a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to ct 3; 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision; deft is placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 2 & 3; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge.
With Kayla/Atty McGrath and ADA Phan, and with PSI writer Kali Morgan, the SEH of 5/10/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty McGrath is unavailable on that date; reset to 4/28/16 at 2:30pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 2 & 3.  Atty McGrath withdraws motion filed to compel production of discovery or dismiss ct 1 for reasons set forth on the record.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 4 are dismissed.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 3.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 5/10/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Order on funeral release; deft may be released Saturday 2/27/16 at 9am to attend the funeral of his mother at Piasecki Funeral Home; he is to return to the jail before 3pm; he will be in the company of Janet N. at all times; she has agreed to be responsible for his release time; he is permitted to change clothes at 1108 87th Ave #4; all rules of the jail are in full force and effect while released.
from Atty McGrath.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  MH to compel set for 2/18/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.
